kszucs commented on issue #1889: ARROW-2300: [C++/Python] Integration test for HDFS
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/1889#issuecomment-402866885
 
 
   @wesm I could use some hints:
   
   With libhdfs3 it still segfaults when [setting](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/arrow/io/hdfs.cc#L300) `HdfsPathInfo` string members.
   
   In the [ListDirectory](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/arrow/io/io-hdfs-test.cc#L279) test case the first [iteration](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/arrow/io/hdfs.cc#L450) goes well, but afterwards `char*` pointers have bogus addresses. For a single file, the test case passes.
   
   There must be something obvious I can't find. Maybe this [bad_alloc](https://github.com/Pivotal-Data-Attic/attic-c-hdfs-client/blob/36cc257d99919f2b98c998ad300ce660fa90b6a2/src/client/Hdfs.cpp#L1053) handling causes it?
   
   
   
   

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #1889: ARROW-2300: [C++/Python] Integration test for HDFS
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/1889#issuecomment-402873517
 
 
   Oof, sorry that you've run into this. libhdfs3 2.3.x. on conda-forge introduced an ABI incompatibility, see
   
   https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1465
   
   In the meantime, you can pin to version 2.2.31 to make the problem go away

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

fields.description:
Tried this on a fresh Ubuntu 16.04 install:

{code}
$ ./test_hdfs.sh 
+ docker build -t arrow-hdfs-test -f hdfs/Dockerfile .
Sending build context to Docker daemon  36.86kB
Step 1/6 : FROM cpcloud86/impala:metastore
manifest for cpcloud86/impala:metastore not found
{code}

comments.body: [~cpcloud] we might want to set up a minimal HDFS image that isn't dependent on any Impala-related docker images
